institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Industry-led youth customized training business operation rules/Article 23 (application for subsidies, etc.)
contents: Article 23 (Application for subsidy, etc.) ① If a project group wishes to receive a subsidy, it must fill out and submit the “Industry-Led Youth Customized Training Project Subsidy Application”. ② After confirming whether the project group has paid its contribution, the business group shall only apply for the industry-led training project. You can pay the subsidy in installments through your bank account. However, in the case of a business group that has difficulty paying the contribution due to unavoidable reasons, the support fund may be paid after deliberation and resolution by the deliberation committee., ③ The business group transfers the contribution into a separate dedicated account that is distinct from the account dedicated to industry-led training projects. It must be managed and executed., ④ If the project group receives payment of operating expenses, training facility/equipment expenses, program development expenses, etc. pursuant to Article 19 (1) of the Operation Regulations, it must submit a performance guarantee insurance policy, etc. by the day before the support payment date. In this case, the insurance amount must be more than the sum of the subsidy and the agreed interest equivalent to the guarantee or insurance period for the subsidy., ⑤ The guarantee or insurance period under paragraph 4 shall be the end date of the project implementation period (for facilities and equipment). The subsidy is for 6 years from the year in which the relevant facilities and equipment were supported. ⑥ If any of the following cases applies, the business group may not submit the performance guarantee insurance policy, etc. pursuant to paragraph 4 by submitting a 「Support Return Confirmation」., 1. In accordance with the 「Act on the Management of Public Institutions」 2. A corporation protected and fostered by the government pursuant to a special law and funded by the government; 3. An institution notified by the Minister of Government Administration and Home Affairs pursuant to the Act on the Management of Local Government-Invested and Contributed Institutions; 4 National and public universities under the Higher Education Act, 5. National research institutes and government-funded research institutes under Article 2, Paragraph 5 of the Special Act on the Promotion of Special Research and Development Zones, 6.
